  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath0 be an algebraically closed field of characteristic @xmath1 . in sharp contrast with the situation in characteristic @xmath12 ,",
    "there exist galois covers @xmath7 ramified only over infinity . by abhyankar s conjecture @xcite , proved by raynaud and harbater @xcite , @xcite",
    ", a finite group @xmath2 occurs as the galois group of such a cover @xmath13 if and only if @xmath2 is quasi-@xmath6 , i.e. , @xmath2 is generated by @xmath6-groups .",
    "this result classifies all the finite quotients of the fundamental group @xmath14 .",
    "it does not , however , determine the profinite group structure of @xmath14 because this fundamental group is an infinitely generated profinite group .",
    "there are many open questions about galois covers @xmath7 ramified only over infinity . for example , given a finite quasi-@xmath6 group @xmath2 , what is the smallest integer @xmath15 for which there exists a cover @xmath7 ramified only over infinity with @xmath9 of genus @xmath15 ?",
    "as another example , suppose @xmath2 and @xmath16 are two finite quasi-@xmath6 groups such that @xmath16 is a quotient of @xmath2 .",
    "given an unramified galois cover @xmath17 of @xmath18 with group @xmath16 , under what situations can one dominate @xmath17 with an unramified galois cover @xmath13 of @xmath18 with galois group @xmath2 ?",
    "answering these questions will give progress towards understanding how the finite quotients of @xmath14 fit together in an inverse system .",
    "these questions are more tractible for quasi-@xmath6 groups that are @xmath6-groups since the maximal pro-@xmath6 quotient @xmath19 is free ( of infinite rank ) @xcite .    in this paper , we study galois covers @xmath7 ramified only over @xmath8 whose galois group is a semi - direct product of the form @xmath3 , where @xmath5 is a prime distinct from @xmath6 .",
    "such a cover @xmath13 must be a composition @xmath20 where @xmath21 is unramified and @xmath22 is an artin - schreier cover ramified only over @xmath8 .",
    "the cover @xmath17 has an affine equation @xmath23 for some @xmath24 $ ] with degree @xmath25 prime - to-@xmath6 .",
    "the @xmath5-torsion @xmath26 $ ] of the jacobian of @xmath27 is isomorphic to @xmath28 . when @xmath29 , we determine how an automorphism @xmath30 of @xmath27 of order @xmath6 acts on @xmath26 $ ] .",
    "this allows us to construct a galois cover @xmath31 ramified only over @xmath8 which dominates @xmath17 , such that the galois group of @xmath32 is @xmath33 where @xmath10 is the order of @xmath5 modulo @xmath6 ( section  [ exist ] ) .",
    "we prove that the genus of @xmath34 is minimal among all natural numbers that occur as the genus of a curve @xmath9 which admits a covering map @xmath7 ramified only over @xmath8 with galois group of the form @xmath3 .",
    "we also prove that the number of curves @xmath9 of this minimal genus which admit such a covering map is at most @xmath11 when @xmath6 is odd ( section  [ unique ] ) .",
    "we recall which groups occur as galois groups of covers of @xmath35 ramified only over @xmath8 .",
    "[ quasi - p ] a finite group is a quasi @xmath6-group if it is generated by all of its sylow @xmath6-subgroups .",
    "it is well - known that there are other equivalent formulations of the quasi-@xmath6 property , such as the next result .",
    "[ lem : quasi - p ] a finite group is a quasi @xmath6-group if and only if it has no nontrivial quotient group whose order is relatively prime to @xmath6 .",
    "the importance of the quasi-@xmath6 property is that it characterizes which finite groups occur as galois groups of unramified covers of the affine line .    [ tabconj ] a finite group occurs as the galois group of a galois cover of the projective line @xmath35 ramified only over infinity if and only if it is a quasi-@xmath6 group .",
    "this is a special case of abhyankar s conjecture @xcite which was jointly proved by harbater @xcite and raynaud @xcite .",
    "we now restrict our attention to groups @xmath2 that are semi - direct products of the form @xmath3 .",
    "the semi - direct product action is determined by a homomorphism @xmath36 .",
    "[ lgroup ] suppose a quasi-@xmath6 group @xmath2 is a semi - direct product of the form @xmath3 for a positive integer @xmath4 .    1 .",
    "then @xmath2 is not a direct product .",

    ", @xmath41 is an inclusion .",
    "thus @xmath42 has an element of order @xmath6 .",
    "now @xmath43 thus @xmath44 for some positive integer @xmath45 which implies @xmath37 .",
    "[ lexistgb ] if @xmath46 , then there exists a semi - direct product of the form @xmath33 which is quasi-@xmath6 .",
    "it is unique up to isomorphism .",
    "if @xmath46 , then there is an element of order @xmath6 in @xmath47 and so there is an injective homomorphism @xmath48 .",
    "thus there exists a non - abelian semi - direct product @xmath2 of the form @xmath33 . to show that @xmath2 is quasi-@xmath6 , suppose @xmath49 is a normal subgroup of @xmath2 whose index is relatively prime to @xmath6",

    "thus @xmath51 is a proper subgroup of @xmath49 .",
    "it follows that @xmath5 divides @xmath52 and so @xmath49 contains an element @xmath53 of order @xmath5 by cauchy s theorem .",
    "recall that @xmath54 contains no element of order @xmath6 for any positive integer @xmath55 .",

    "thus @xmath57 and @xmath2 has no non - trivial quotient group whose order is relatively prime to @xmath6 . by lemma [ lem : quasi - p ] , @xmath2 is quasi-@xmath6 .",

    ", we may assume that @xmath265 has affine equation @xmath266 .    from the proof of proposition  [ pexist ]",
    ", the action of @xmath30 on @xmath267 $ ] decomposes into the direct sum of two @xmath180-dimensional subrepresentations .",
    "in other words , the action of @xmath30 is diagonal with both eigenvalues equal to @xmath268 .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be an algebraically closed field of characteristic @xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> let @xmath2 be a semi - direct product of the form @xmath3 where @xmath4 is a positive integer and @xmath5 is a prime distinct from @xmath6 . in this paper , we study galois covers @xmath7 ramified only over @xmath8 with galois group @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> we find the minimal genus of a curve @xmath9 which admits a covering map of this form and we give an explicit formula for this genus in terms of @xmath5 and @xmath6 . </S>",
    "<S> the minimal genus occurs when @xmath4 equals the order @xmath10 of @xmath5 modulo @xmath4 and we also prove that the number of curves @xmath9 of this minimal genus which admit such a covering map is at most @xmath11 when @xmath6 is odd . </S>"
  ]
}
